column4: Hi... I read somewhere that it's possible to mix and match different things in the desktop environment. Like using a replacement for nautilus, for instance. Can someone direct me to some alternative apps for this?
maybe it will make more sense if you run a program, press ctrl-z and try to use the program
sed maybe?  I doubt it's worth it though
well, anything to speed things up a bit :P
well, the drive is hard to get to and doesn't have any of its brandings visible
use 'sudo lshw' to get a model number of some kind for it, then use google
why not just use metacity that's default in GNOME?
Well, metacity works fine, i just want to try something different as a learning experience
ah, in that case:  fluxbox (or any of the other boxes), fvwm, icewm, ratpoison, ... there's one more I liked but i forget the name :( ...  are fun to try
java virtual machine and because it is java
